CodeBlock.description:
Execute a piece of code.

Example:
```PDL
- def: N
  lang: python
  code: |
    import random
    # (In PDL, set `result` to the output you wish for your code block.)
    result = random.randint(1, 20)
```

spec.description: Type specification of the result of the block.
spec.title: Spec

defs.description: Set of definitions executed before the execution of the block.

def.description: Name of the variable used to store the result of the execution of the block.
def.title: Def

contribute.description: Indicate if the block contributes to the result and background context.
contribute.title: Contribute

parser.description: Parser to use to construct a value out of a string result.
parser.title: Parser

fallback.description: Block to execute in case of error.
fallback.title: Fallback

Typical roles are `system`, `user`, and `assistant`,
but there may be other roles such as `available_tools`.
role.title: Role

CodeBlock.title: CodeBlock

DataBlock.description:
Arbitrary value, equivalent to JSON.

Example. As part of a `defs` section, set `numbers` to the list `[1, 2, 3, 4]`:
```PDL
defs:
  numbers:
    data: [1, 2, 3, 4]
```

Example.  Evaluate `${ TEST.answer }` in
[Jinja](https://jinja.palletsprojects.com/en/stable/), passing
the result to a regex parser with capture groups.  Set
`EXTRACTED_GROUND_TRUTH` to an object with attribute `answer`,
a string, containing the value of the capture group.
```PDL
- data: ${ TEST.answer }
  parser:
    regex: "(.|\n)*#### (?P<answer>([0-9])*)\n*"
    spec:
      answer: str
  def: EXTRACTED_GROUND_TRUTH
```

IfBlock.description:
Conditional control structure.

Example:
```PDL
- if: ${ eval == 'no' }
  then:
    text:
    - read:
      message: "Why not?\n"
```

LitellmModelBlock.description:
Call an LLM through [the LiteLLM API](https://docs.litellm.ai/).

Example:
```PDL
- model: ollama/granite-code:8b
  parameters:
    stop: ['!']
```

RepeatBlock.description:
Repeat the execution of a block.

For loop example:
```PDL
for:
    number: [1, 2, 3, 4]
    name: ["Bob", "Carol", "David", "Ernest"]
repeat:
    "${ name }'s number is ${ number }\n"
```
